Definition of Cyber-Bullyning: communication in which a user intentionally annoys one or more others in a web community
Type of Cyber-bullying: personal insult harassment in which a user systematically deprecates the contributions of another user
venue: the Content Analysis in the WEB (CAW 2.0)

Paper: Sentiment analysis for effective detection of cyber bullying
Dataset:
kongregate (4,802)
slashdot (4,303)
myspace (1,946)
twitter (4865) data from CAW 2
Data Collection process: Twitter data is from CAW2 and the rest borrowed from othe researchers
Innovative model: Graph model to detct bullyies and victims
Comments: I do not trust the results as they used acciracy which might reflect the TN which is overwhelming in the dataset

is  an aggressive intentional act carried out by a group of indiciuals using

Paper: Identification and characterization of cyberbullying dynamics in an online social network
Definition of Cyber-Bullyning: is defined as using information technology to willfully and repeatedly hurt, insult or harass others.
Text Feature:
BOW
second person pronouns
offensive words
User info features:
age
gender
degree centerality
betweeness centerality
closness centerality
eigenvector centerality
clustering coefficient
venue: International Conference on Advances in Social Networks Analysis and Mining

Paper: Cyberbullying detection based on semantic-enhanced marginalized denoising auto-encoder
Definition of Cyber-Bullyning:
is an aggressive intentional actions performed by an individual or a group of people 
via digital communication methods such as sending messages and posting comments against a victim
Data Collection process:
Twitter data was crawled using keywords, then manullay labelled
myspace data was labelled by 3 labellers
Preprocessing:
tokenization
stemming
remove stop words
replace user mentions urls with predefined characters
baselines:
Bullying word matching
semantic enhances BOW
LSA
LDA
mSDA
venue: IEEE Transactions on Affective Computing journal

Paper: Sentiment Informed Cyberbullying Detection in Social Media
Definition of Cyber-Bullyning:
It is defined as the phenomena of using
the internet, cell phones and other electronic devices to willfully hurt or harass
others.
Innovative model:
ML model that includes alpha and beta as parameters to control the contribution of user-post relation
and sentiment information, respectively.
baselines: LR, Lasso, NMF, SVM (TF-idf + unnigrams POS + profanity words list), SVM (TF-idf + user information)
Comments:
1- they use Stanford Twitter Sentiment DS with distant supervised based sentiment ML model  to measure the sentiment score distribution of datasets.
2- we propose to incorporate sentiment information to detect cyberbullying behaviors.
3-sparse learning ha
